page.title: 01Farming Edge Of Breckland
page.content: Predominately agricultural; embracing parts of three villages Fornham St.Martin, St.Genevieve and All Saints. Few of the inhabitants of these villages are employed in agriculture. The majority travel to work in the neighbouring towns of Bury St. Edmunds, and Thetford. Many older people settle here in retirement to enjoy the rural amenities of the region. The areas is quite beautiful being generally low lying but gently undulating. It is well wooded which together with the arable type farming lends itself to a variety of country sports, such as game shooting, fox hunting, and fishing. Other sporting amenities include a golf course and a point to point racecourse. The greatest part of the land is farmed by just two farming families. There has been a church at Timworth since the
